form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Kirk (for himself and Mr. Booker) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To use amounts provided for the Fund for the Improvement of Education to establish a pilot program that supports year-round public elementary schools and secondary schools.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the All-Year Schools Support Act.

subsection.text: Section 5411 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7243) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (9) as paragraph (10); and
by inserting after paragraph (8) the following:

paragraph.text: Activities to establish or expand programs providing year-round education at public elementary schools or secondary schools, which may include increasing the salaries of teachers who agree to work in the year-round education programs by an amount not to exceed 100 percent.
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Pilot program for year-Round school activities

paragraph.text: From the amounts described in paragraph (2), the Secretary shall carry out a multi-year pilot program that awards 4 grants, to eligible entities described in paragraph (3), to carry out the activities described in subsection (b)(9).

paragraph.header: Funding limit for the pilot program
paragraph.text: The Secretary shall use, from the amounts provided under section 5401 for fiscal years 2016 through 2019 for this subpart, a total of $4,000,000 to carry out the pilot program described in paragraph (1).
Entities described in subsection (a), except for institutions of higher education, shall be eligible for grants under this subsection.
In awarding grants under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: give a priority to eligible entities that—

clause.text: propose to use grant funds to carry out year-round education activities that emphasize science, technology, engineering, and mathematics; and
target the year-round education activities to be carried out under the grant to areas with high populations of low-income individuals and to low-performing schools; and

subparagraph.text: ensure an equitable distribution of such grants across diverse geographic areas.
